definition[0]: on the land, not in the sea
definition[1]: onshore winds are moving from the sea towards the land
definition[2]: involving an activity performed in a particular country, rather than outside it
example[1]: The Thai baht reached new lows in onshore trading in Bangkok.
definition[3]: a bank etc that is based in a country where taxes are at normal levels, laws are strict etc
example[2]: The bank now wants to expand in onshore business centres such as London, New York and Tokyo.
definition[4]: connected with oil and gas production that is done on land
example[3]: There was only one onshore discovery last year out of seven exploration wells drilled.
